title: Dustin Poirier turns down Dan Hooker fight because he's fighting Conor McGregor next
text:
Poirier has named himself as McGregor’s next opponent (Picture: Getty)

Dustin Poirier claims he is fighting Conor McGregor next after snubbing Dan Hooker’s call-out.

The UFC lightweight was Hooker’s target after the New Zealander beat Al Iaquinta at UFC 243 in Australia. ‘Dustin Poirier, I’m going to smash your face in. Meet me in New Zealand 2020, and I’m going to end you,’ Hooker said in the cage after his points victory.

Poirier responded to Hooker on social media after hearing the call-out and appeared to confirm his rematch with McGregor.

He said: ‘I’m fighting the Irishman next. You’re close but not yet buddy keep punching.’

I'm fighting the Irishman next. You're close but not yet buddy keep punching @danthehangman — The Diamond (@DustinPoirier) October 6, 2019

McGregor and Poirier have been going back and forth on social media since the latter’s defeat to Khabib Nurmagomedov last month.

Poirier is keen to rematch McGregor, who he lost to in 2014 via a first-round knockout.

McGregor is yet to make an announcement about his own return to action, but has named Poirier as a potential opponent, alongside Justin Gaethje and Nate Diaz.

Diaz headlines Madison Square Garden in November in his clash with Jorge Masvidal and McGregor may chose to be cageside for his old rival’s fight.

McGregor is not expected to fight in 2019 unless he spearheads the UFC’s final pay-per-view event of the year in December in Las Vegas.

The Irishman sparked rumours about a comeback in his hometown when he tweeted last month ‘Dublin, December 14th’, but UFC boss Dana White has since shot down any chance his star attraction could fight in the Irish capital on that date.
